LAST WEEK BUT TWO

O F THIS SEASON.

The Public is respectfully informed, that this Theatre, being compelled by its license to close on tin*
14th of January, the various celebrated Artists cannot be seen beyond that period again in
London until Easter next.

SEASON.

The public is respectfully informed, that this Theatre, being compelled by its license to close on the
14th of January, the various celebrated Artists engaged at this Establishment will not perform
beyond that period again in London until Easter next.

Madame

At t h a t moment the ground opened, and the Princess saw, with the greatest
surprise, A LARGE K I T C H E N filled with a number of Cooks, all busy, and
sinsing all the time, as meiry as could be."

T H B SEASON.

Green-Horu the Great,

The Public is respectfully informed, that this Theatre, being compelled by its license to close on the
14th of January, the various celebrated Artists engaged at this Establishment will not perform,
beyond that period again in London until Easter next.

Has been erected, and no expense spared (o render this Establishment deserving its high character
and t h e support of the Patrons of the D r a m a .

E X T E N S I V E ALTERATION'S :
THE PROSCENIUM HAS BEEN ENTIRELY REMODELLED;
AND T H EW H O L E O P T U B

AND

W I T H CERTAIN CONTINGENT ADVANTAGES FOR AN

M r . W K H S T E R , Lessee of the** Little T h e a t r e in the H a y - m a r Ret,**
respectfully offers, t o r the encouragement of D r a m a t i c L i t e r a t u r e in this
C o u n t r y , t h e above sum for t h e best modern COMEDY, illustrative in
plot and c h a r a c t e r o f British Manners and Customs. T h e merit of t h e
Comedy t o he decided h y a Committee, on Monday, J a n u a r y 1, IS I t ,
composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors.) D r a m a t i c Critics and
Actors (male and female) to h e named h y Mr. W e b s t e r ; and Mr. W e b s t e r
to have t h e casting vote, if r e q u i r e d . T h e Comedies to h e sent in anonymously, w i t h a motto. The F I Y E H U N D R E D POUNDS t o be paid immediately on the final decision of the Committee, w i t h t h e advantage of
a clear t h i r d of the gross receipts on t h e StOth, 4Oth, and OOth Nights of
Representation. F u r t h e r a r r a n g e m e n t s to be regulated h y t h e Committee.
January 3, 1843.

CONTINGENT ADVANTAGES, FOR AN

ORIGINAL ENGLISH COMEDY.
Mr, W E B S T E R , Lessee of the *• Little T h e a t r e in the liny-market,*'
respectfully o n e r s , tor the encouragement of D r a m a t i c L i t e r a t u r e in thU
C o u n t r y , t h e above sum t o r t h e best modern COMEDY, in F i v e Acts,
illustrative, in plot and c h a r a c t e r , of British Manners and Customs. T h e
m e r i t ot t h e Comedy to be decided b y a Committee, on Monday, J a n u a r y
1, i t t l l . composed o f D r a m a t i c Authors, (not competitors.) D r a m a t i c
Critics, and Actors (male and temale) to be named b y Mr. W e b s t e r ; a n d
Mr. W e b s t e r to have the casting vote, if r e q u i r e d . T h e Comedies t o be
sent in anonymously, with a motto. T h e F I V E HUNDRED POUNDS t o
be paid immediately on t h e final decision of the Committee, w i t h t h e
a d v a n t a g e of a clear third of t h e gross receipts on t h e StOth, lOtli, and
OOth niights of Representation. F u r t h e r a r r a n g e m e n t s t o be regulated by
t h e Committee.

M r . W E B S T E R , Lessee o f t h e ••Little T h e a t r e i n t h e H a y - m a r k e t , "
r e s p e c t f u l l y offers, l o r t h e e n c o u r a g e m e n t o f D r a m a t i c L i t e r a t u r e in t h i s
C o u n t r y , t h e a b o v e s u m t o r t h e best m o d e r n C O M E R V , i n F i v e A c t s ,
illustrative, in plot and c h a r a c t e r , o r British Manners and Customs. T h e
m e r i t ot t h e C o m e d y t o b e d e c i d e d b y a C o m m i t t e e , o n M o n d a y , J a n u a r y
1. I * 1 1 , c o m p o s e d o f D r a m a l i c A u t h o r s , ( n o t c o m p e t i t o r s . ) D r a m a t i c
C r i t i c s , a n d A c t o r s ( m a l e a n d t e i n a l e ) to b e n a m e d b y M r , W e b s t e r ; a n d
M r . W e b s t e r to h a v e t h e c a s t i n g v o t e , i f r e q u i r e d . T h e Comedies t o b e
sent in anonymously, w i t h a motto. The F I V E H U N D R E D POUNDS t o
b e p a i d i m m e d i a t e l y o n t h e final decision o f t h e C o m m i t t e e , w i t h t h e
a d v a n t a g e o f a c l e a r t h i r d o f t h e gross r e c e i p t s o n t h e 2 O t h , 4 O t h , a n d
OOth Nights of R e p r e s e n t a t i o n . F u r t h e r a r r a n g e m e n t s t o b e r e g u l a t e d b y
the Committee.

CONTINGENT ADVANTAGES, FOR AN

ORIGINAL ENGLISH COMEDY,
(To be commenced after the Date of this Advertisement)
Mr. W E B S T E R , Lessee of the " L i t t l e T h e a t r e in the Hay-market,**
respectfully offers, tor the encouragement of O r a m a t i c L i t e r a t u r e in this
C o u n t r y , t h e above sum for the best modern COMEDY, in F i v e Acts,
illustrative, in plot and c h a r a e t e r , o r British Manners and Customs. T h e
merit of t h e Comedy to be decided b y a Committee, on Monday, J a n u a r y
1, IS 1 1 , composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors.) Dramatic
Critics, and Actors (male and female) to be named b y Mr. W e b s t e r ; a n d
Mr. W e b s t e r to h a v e the casting vote, if r e q u i r e d . T h e Comeilles to be
sent in anonymously, w i t h a motto. The F I V E H I NDRED P O I N D S t o
h e paid Immediately on t h e final decision of the Committee, w i t h t h e
advantage of a c l e a r third of t h e gross receipts on t h e Sloth, lOth, and
OOth Nights of Representation. F u r t h e r a r r a n g e m e n t s to be regulated by
t h e Committee.

CONTINGENT ADVANTAGES, FOR AN

(To be commenced after the Bate of this Advertisement)

Mr. W E R S T E R . Lessee o r the**Little T h e a t r e in t h e Hay-market.**
respectfully oilers, tor the encouragement of Dramatic L i t e r a t u r e in this
Country, the a b o v e sum for the best PROSE COMEDY, in 45 Acts, illus.
trative. in plot and c h a r a c t e r , oi modern British Manners and Customs,
T h e merit ot the Comedy to be decided b y a Committee, on Monday, J a n .
B, I S 4 4 , composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors.) Dramatic
Critics, and Actors (male and female) to be named by Mr. W e b s t e r ; a n d
Mr. W e b s t e r to have the casting vote, if r e q u i r e d . T h e Comedies to h e
sent in anonymously, w i t h a motto. T h e F I Y E HYNDRED POUNDS t o
he paid immediately on t h e final decision of the Committee, w i t h thu
advantage of a clear third of the gross receipts on t h e SOth, t o t h , and
GOth Nights of Representation. F u r t h e r arrangements to be regulated fry
t h e Committee.

Will be performed, [First Time this Senium) Mr. HUCKSTONE'K ( omedy of

As the Comedy of 'MARRIED LIFE attempted to illuatrate a few o* the humours of the State Ma*
t r i m . n i a l , and Interest an audience without the introduction of a n y Xiovcr-whatever, the author
•f 'SINGLE LIFE In going to the opposite extreme and making his Characters ' LOVERS ALL ' hopes
to be equally successful in pourtraying «-m- of the vagaries of Courtship, and showing t h a t the
democratic region of celibacy has its bickerings »* well as the most loyal one of ' The United States.'

respectfully otters, lor the encouragement of D r a m a t i c L i t e r a t u r e in this
Country, the above sum for the l>e«t P R O S E COMEDY, in & Acts, illustrative, in pint and c h a r a c t e r , of modern British Manners and Customs.
The merit of the Comedy to he decided h y a Cominitf ee.af ler Monday, .Ian
1, I H I I , composed of D r a m a t i c Authors, (not competitors.) D r a m a t i c
Critics, and Actors (male and female) to be named b y Mr. W e b s t e r ; a n d
Mr. W e b s t e r to have t h e casting vote, if r e q u i r e d . The Comedies t o b e
sent in anonymously, w i t h a motto. The F I V E 111 VORKH POUNDS t o
be paid immediately on the final decision of the Committee, w i t h t h e
advantage of a clear third of t h e gross receipts on the SOth, lOtli, and
OOth Nights of Representation. F u r t h e r a r r a n g e m e n t s to be regulated * y

respectfully oilers, l o r t h e e n c o u r a g e m e n t of D r a m a t i c L i t e r a t u r e in this

Critics, and Actors (male and-female) to b e named b y Mr. W e b s t e r ; a n d
Mr. W e b s t e r to have the casting vote, if r e q u i r e d . T h e Comedies t o b e
sent i n anonymously, w i t h a motto. T h e F I V E H U N D R E D POUNDS t o
b e p a i d i m m e d i a t e l y o n t h e final d e c i s i o n o f t h e C o m m i t t e e , w i t h t h e
a d v a n t a g e of a clear t h i r d of t h e gross receipts o n t h e SOth, 4 0 t h , a n d

( ONTLNGLNT ADVANTAGES, FOR AN

OUII.IX VI, ENGLISH COMEDY,
(To be conniienced after the Date of this Advertisement)

Mr, W E B S T E R , Lessee of the** Little T h e a t r e in t h e Hay-market,**
respectfully offers, for the encouragement of Dramatic L i t e r a t u r e in this
C o u n t r y , t h e ahove sum for t h e best P R O S E COMEDY, in » Acts, illustrative, in plot and c h a r a c t e r , ot modern British Manners and Customs*
T h e merit of the Comedy to he decided h y a Committee.aiter Monday, . I a n
1, 1S44, composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors.) Dramatic
Critics, and Actors (male and female) to he named hy Mr. W e b s t e r * and
Mr. W e b s t e r to have the casting vote. If required. T h e Comedies to be
sent in anonymously, with a motto. The F I V E H I KDRED POUNDS to
be paid immediately on t h e final decision of t h e Committee, w i t h th«
advantage of a clear third of t h e gross receipts on t h e 3Oth, l O t h , and
OOth Nights of Representation. F u r t h e r arrangements t o be regulated by
the Committee.

VO DRAMATIC AIITRORI.

£#?OO, C E R T A I N ,
WITH

CONTINGENT ADVANTAGES, FOR AN

ORIGINAL MULISH COMEDY 9
(To be commenced after the Date of this Advertisement)

Mr. IVEBSTEH, Lessee of the ** Little Theatre in the Hay-market,*'
respectfully offers, for the encouragement of Dramatic Literature in thin
Country, the above sum for the best PROSE COMEDY, in 5 Acts, illustrative, in plot and character, of modern British Manners and Customs.
The merit of the Comedy to be decided b y a Committee.alter Monday, J a n .
1, 1S44. composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors.) Dramatic
Critics, and Actors (male and female) to be named by Mr. Webster; and
Mr. Webster to have the casting vote, if required. The Comedies to be
sent in anonymously, with a motto. The F I V E HUNDRED POUNDS to
be paid immediately on the final decision of the Committee, with the
advantage of a clear third of the gross receipts on the -toth, 40th, and
• O t h Nights of Representation. Further arrangements to be regulated by
the Committee.
Junr 3, 184-3.

Mr. W E B S T E R , Lessee of the " L i t t l e T h e a t r e in the H a y - m a r k e t . "
respectfully offers, for the encouragement of Dramatic L i t e r a t u r e in this
Country, the above sum for the toest PROSE, C O J I E B Y , in S Acts, illustrative, in plot and character, of modern British Manners and Customs.
The merit of the Comedy to he decidedtoya Committecalter Monday, J a n .
1, 184_, composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors*) Dramatic
Critics, and Actors (male and female) to be named hy Mr. W e b s t e r ; and
Mr. W e b s t e r to have the casting vote, if required. The Comedies to be
sent in anonymously, w i t h a motto. The F I V E HUNDRED POUNDS to
be paid immediately on the final decision of the Committee, w i t h the
advantage of a clear third of the gross receipts on t h e StOth, _Oth, and
OOtli Nights of Representation. F u r t h e r arrangements to be regulated by
the Committee.
June 3, 1843.

Mr. W E B S T E R . Lessee of the ••Little T h e a t r e in the Hay-market.'*
respectfully offers, for the encouragement of Dramatic L i t e r a t u r e in thi-»
Country, the above sum for the best PROSE COMEDY, an 5 Acts, illustrative, in plot and c h a r a c t e r , ot modern British Manners and Customs.
T h e merit ot the Comedy to be decided by a Committee.alf e r Monday, J a n .
1, I S 4 4 , composed of Dramatic Anthors, (not competitors.) Dramatic
Critics, ano Actors (male and female) to be named b y Mr. W e b s t e r ; and
Mr. W e b s t e r to have the casting vote, if required. T h e Comedies t o be
son! in anonymously, w i t h a motto. The F I V E HUNDRED POUNDS to
be i»aid immediately on the final decision o r the Committee, w i t h the
advantage of a c i n a r third of the gross receipts on the SOth, 4 0 t h , and
SOth Nights of Representation. F u r t h e r arrangements to be regulated by
the Committee.

Mr WEBSTER, Lessee of the -Little Theatre in the Hay-market,"
respectfully otters, tor the encouragement of Dramatic Literature in this
Country, the above sum for the best PROSE COMEDY, in S Acts, illustrative, in plot and character, of modern British Manners and Customs.

CONTINGENT ADVANTAGES, FOR AN

ORIGINAL ENGLISH COMEDY 9
(To be commenced after the Date of this Advertisement)
Mr. W E B S T E R , Lessee or the •• Little T h e a t r e in the Hay-market,**
respectfully o n e r s , for the encouragement of Dramatic L i t e r a t u r e in this
Country, the above sum for th«* best PROSE COMEDY, in 5 Acts, illustrative, in plot and character, of modern Rritish Manners and Customs.
The merit of the Comedy to be decided by a Committee,altcr Monday, .Ian.
I , IH 11, composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors.) Dramatic
Critics, and Actors (male and female) to be named b y Mr. W e b s t e r ; and
Mr. W e b s t e r to have the casting vote, if r e q u i r e d . The Comedies to be
sent in anonymously, w i t h a motto. T h e ITVfi m V D K K H 1*<H \ 1>H to
be paid immediately on the final decision of the Committee, w i t h th«
advantage of a clear third of t h e gross receipts on the SOth, lOth, and
GOth Nights of Representation. F u r t h e r arrangements to be regulated by
the Committee.
June : j . 1843.

Mr. W E B S T E R , Leseee o r t h e •• Little T h e a t r e in t h e Hay-market.**
respeettiilly offers, lor the encouragement of Dramatic L i t e r a t u r e in this
Country, the above MUm for the best P R O S E COMEDY, in » Acts, illust r a t i v e , in plot and c h a r a c t e r , ol modern British Manners and Customs.
T h e merit ot the Comedy to he decided b y a Cominittee,atter Monday, J a n .
1, I S t l . composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors.) Dramatic
Critics, and Actors (male and temale) to be named b y Mr. W e b s t e r ; a n d
Mr. WebMer to have the casting vote, if r e q u i r e d . T h e Comedies t o bo
sent in anonymously, w i t h a motto. T h e F I V E H U N D R E D POUNDS to
be paid immediately on t h e tinal decision o r the Committee, w i t h t h e
advantage of a clear third of t h e gro«« receipts on the 3OI h, lOth, a n d
OOth Nights of Representation. F u r t h e r arrangement* t o be regulated by
t h e Committee.

CERTAIN

C O N T I N G E N T A D V A N T A G E S . F O R AN

ORIGINAL IM.USII COMEDY,
(To be commenced after the Date of this Advertisement)

Mr, W E B S T E R . Lessee of the •• Little T h e a t r e in t h e Hay-market.**
res pert t a l l y oilers, tor the encouragement of Dramatic L i t e r a t u r e in this
Country, the above sum for the best PROSE COMEDY, in 5 Acts, i l l u s .
trative. in plot and character, ot modern British Manners and Customs.
The merit ol the Comedy to be decided by a Committee,alter Monday, J a n .
I , 1*11. composed of Dramatic Authors, (not competitors.) Dramatic
Critics, and Actors (male and female) to be named by Mr. W e b s t e r ; and
Mr. W e b s t e r to have the casting; vote. If r e q u i r e d . T h e Comedies to be
rt<*nt in anonymously, w i t h a motto. T h e F I V E H I NiRRED P O I N D S to
be liaid immediately on the linal decision of the Committee, w i t h t h e

the only Two-Persons who escaped out of Seventy-five in one house, at the late disastrous Earthquake
